informal_statement: Show that for any real number $a$, $a(2-a)\leq 1$.
informal_proof: We have that for any real number $a$, $(a - 1)^2 \geq 0$. So, $a^2 - 2a + 1 \geq 0$. As a result, $a(2-a) = 2a - a^2 \leq 1$.
formal_statement:
theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory algebra_sqineq_at2malt1
  imports Complex_Main
begin

theorem algebra_sqineq_at2malt1:
  fixes a::real 
  shows "a * (2 - a) \<le> 1"
proof -
  have "(a-1)^2 \<ge>0" by auto
  then show ?thesis unfolding power2_eq_square
    by (auto simp:algebra_simps)
qed

end
